definition: to depart this life/to be no more

sentences.english: I may not be here next week.
sentences.chinese: 或許我下週就要溘然長逝了。

sentences.english: It sinks; and I am ready to depart.
sentences.chinese: 一旦生命的火消沉，我願悄然長逝。

sentences.english: I am the stars warmly greaming, Prada shoes women, over Darnassus softly dreaming.
sentences.chinese: 我是暖和閃耀的星，暉映達納蘇斯的安謐長逝。

sentences.english: Emerson: She's supposed to be in the ground.
Forgotten Sailors Sleep with Eyes Open Dreaming of a Salt Water Death.
sentences.chinese: 被淡忘的水手們睜着雙眼睡去，夢見那海水中的長逝。

sentences.english: She lay down and, turning her face to the wall, passed away.
sentences.chinese: 她躺下，把臉轉向牆壁，便溘然長逝了。

definition: seriously ill and about to die
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
World Games/abbr. for 世界運動會|世界运动会[Shi4 jie4 Yun4 dong4 hui4]
Jintai District of Baoji City 寶雞市|宝鸡市[Bao3 ji1 Shi4], Shaanxi
to visit a place for the memories/to pay homage to (the deceased)
